headline: US eases sanctions after Venezuela passes oil law reforms
summary:
STORY: Venezuela has approved a sweeping reform of its main oil law, a fast‚Äëtracked move aimed at reviving the country‚Äôs ailing energy industry.

Lawmakers on Thursday (January 29) backed interim President Delcy Rodriguez‚Äôs proposal to lower taxes, expand the oil ministry‚Äôs powers, and grant long‚Äësought autonomy to private producers.

The changes also open the door to transferring assets currently controlled by state oil company PDVSA.

:: File

The reform comes as U.S. President Donald Trump pushes a $100 billion reconstruction plan for Venezuela‚Äôs oil sector, following the capture of President Nicol√°s Maduro earlier this month.

Washington eased sanctions on Venezuelan crude exports shortly after the reform passed.

The new law reverses two decades of strict nationalization that drove foreign majors like Exxon and ConocoPhillips out of the country.

Potential investors have described it as "good enough", though some former Venezuela officials say it's unconstitutional. 

The government is expected to evaluate dozens of existing oil joint ventures over the next six months before signing new contracts under the updated model.

headline: Exxon Mobil Shutters Fife Plant As Investors Weigh Valuation And Risks
summary: Exxon Mobil plans to close its Fife Ethylene Plant in Scotland after determining the facility is no longer economically viable. More than 400 jobs are at risk as operations at the site are expected to wind down. The Scottish Government has set up a task force and support funding in response to the closure announcement. For investors watching Exxon Mobil, ticker NYSE:XOM, the move adds a fresh operational shift in Europe to a company already under close scrutiny. The shares most recently...

headline: Oil Earnings, Inflation Data, Likely Fed Chair Decision: Still to Come This Week
summary: More earnings are due, as well as a reading on monthly supplier inflation. headline: Chevron And Exxon Top Earnings But Only One Supermajor Saw Profit Growth; U.S. Oil Prices And Venezuela In Focus
summary: Chevron and Exxon Mobil both reported fourth-quarter earnings and revenue before Friday's stock market open.  Exxon Mobil notched its first quarterly profit increase in more than a year and enters Friday's stock market trading around record highs.  Exxon Mobil reported Friday that Q4 EPS increased 2.4% to $1.71, while revenue declined 1.3% to $82.31 billion.

content.title: Chevron And Exxon Top Earnings But Only One Supermajor Saw Profit Growth; U.S. Oil Prices And Venezuela In Focus

headline: Exxon Mobil beats Q4 earnings, revenue forecasts but shares slip
summary: Investing.com -- Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM) reported better-than-expected earnings and revenue for the fourth quarter, though shares in the oil major slipped over 2% following the release.

content.title: Exxon Mobil beats Q4 earnings, revenue forecasts but shares slip
content.summary: Investing.com -- Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM) reported better-than-expected earnings and revenue for the fourth quarter, though shares in the oil major slipped over 2% following the release.

headline: Exxon Mobil reports strong quarterly profit on solid production at home and abroad
summary: Exxon Mobil topped most expectations in the fourth quarter as the energy giant reported solid production in the Permian Basin and Guyana.  For the three months ended Dec. 31, Exxon earned $6.5 billion, or $1.53 per share.  Excluding one time charges and benefits earnings were $1.71 per share, topping the $1.68 per share that Wall Street was calling for, according to a poll by Zacks Investment Research.

headline: Exxon Earnings Beat Wall Street Expectations. Why The Stock Is Falling.
summary: Shares are at record highs even as analysts trim profit forecasts, putting pressure on Exxon to show how it will deliver long-term growth.

content.title: Exxon Earnings Beat Wall Street Expectations. Why The Stock Is Falling.
content.summary: Shares are at record highs even as analysts trim profit forecasts, putting pressure on Exxon to show how it will deliver long-term growth.

headline: Exxon: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Spring, Texas-based company said it had net income of $1.53 per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were $1.71 per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations, but Exxon does not adjust its reported results based on one-time events such as asset sales.

content.title: Exxon: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The Spring, Texas-based company said it had net income of $1.53 per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were $1.71 per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations, but Exxon does not adjust its reported results based on one-time events such as asset sales.

headline: Exxon, Chevron Post Slimmest Annual Profits Since 2021
summary: Shares of both companies have risen over the past year, despite U.S. oil prices ending 2025 down 20% a barrel.

headline: Exxon Mobil (XOM) Q4 Earnings Top Estimates
summary: Exxon (XOM) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +1.99% and -1.05%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

content.title: Exxon Mobil (XOM) Q4 Earnings Top Estimates
content.summary: Exxon (XOM) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +1.99% and -1.05%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?
